name: Candle Painting Workshop
description: Paint your own elegant taper candles using melted coloured wax. Enjoy tea, snacks, and soft music as you relax into the rhythm of creating four beautiful, hand-decorated candles. No experience needed.

name: Current Cut Film Festival

location.name: Humber Cultural Hub, Recital Hall - access parking lot from Twenty Third St

address.streetAddress: Humber lakeshore West, 3199 Lake Shore Blvd W

description: You are welcome to attend the inaugural Current Cut Film Festival, a new platform celebrating the talents of Humber’s emerging media production, acting and filmmaking professionals. Featuring short films directed and, or produced by current students and recent alumni. There will be an awards ceremony following the festival, honouring films.

name: The G.R.I.D. - Toronto Games Week
description:
Structured playtesting. Industry feedback. A welcoming, behind-the-scenes space where indie devs, studios, and solo creators can show off their games, get honest, helpful feedback, and keep improving—no matter what stage the game’s in. It’s all about structure, support, and moving your project forward with fresh eyes and solid input.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: The Toronto Tattoo Show NIX 2025
description:
Every year, more than 500 national and international tattoo artists join thousands of fans and collectors in downtown Toronto for what is one of the world’s legendary tattoo shows.​ 

This three day international tattoo festival celebrates tattoo culture, lifestyle and art. Join us for a weekend that is considered a tradition of North American tattooing at one of the longest running tattoo conventions in the world. Be a part of our 25th edition show.

name: Taste of Little Italy

location.name: College St - between Bathurst St and Shaw St

description:
Summer’s most anticipated street festival is back! Celebrate Father’s Day weekend with over 200 businesses to shop, dine, and drink your way through.

New this year, enjoy live entertainment on our brand-new main stage at College and Shaw, featuring top artists like American Idol Season 20 finalist Nicolina Bozzo, plus our newest attraction, a food truck festival! Indulge in delicious street eats, sip your favourite drinks at extended patios, and dance to live music with performances on every block all weekend long. Don’t miss the return of our projection art show, sharing the stories of local businesses and the rich history of Little Italy.

name: Giant Video Games - Toronto Games Week
description:
Join us for an unforgettable opening night at Giant Video Games, where you can play massive, Toronto-made video games projected onto the Canada Malting Silos. This exciting event also features an arcade of local games to keep the energy high all evening. 

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!
